parameters.description:
Which catalog of bad words to use, we currently maintain two bad word catalogs:
  • strict - the largest database of bad words which includes profanity, obscenity, sexual, rude, cuss, dirty, swear and objectionable words and phrases. This catalog is suitable for environments of all ages including educational or children's content
  • obscene - like the strict catalog but does not include any mild profanities, idiomatic phrases or words which are considered formal terminology. This catalog is suitable for adult environments where certain types of bad words are considered OK
parameters.name: catalog

parameters.description: The character to use to censor out the bad words found
parameters.name: censor-character

parameters.description:
Execute JavaScript on the page. Each array element should contain a valid JavaScript statement in string form. If a statement returns any kind of value it will be returned in the 'exec-results' response. For your convenience you can also use the following special shortcut functions:
sleep(seconds); Just wait/sleep for the specified number of seconds. click('selector'); Click on the first element matching the given selector. focus('selector'); Focus on the first element matching the given selector. keys('characters'); Send the specified keyboard characters. Use click() or focus() first to send keys to a specific element. enter(); Send the Enter key. tab(); Send the Tab key.
Example:
[ "click('#button-id')", "sleep(1)", "click('.field-class')", "keys('1234')", "enter()" ]
parameters.name: exec

parameters.description: Ignore any TLS/SSL certificate errors and load the page anyway

post.description: Check if a security code sent via SMS Verify or Phone Verify is valid

apiError.description: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed

cardBrand.description: The card brand (e.g. Visa or Mastercard)

cardCategory.description: The card category. There are many different card categories the most common card categories are: CLASSIC, BUSINESS, CORPORATE, PLATINUM, PREPAID

cardType.description: The card type, will always be one of: DEBIT, CREDIT, CHARGE CARD

country.description: The full country name of the issuer

countryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the issuer

countryCode3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the issuer

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country of the issuer

ipBlocklisted.description: True if the customers IP is listed on one of our blocklists, see the IP Blocklist API

ipBlocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklists this IP is listed on

ipCity.description: The city of the customers IP (if detectable)

ipCountry.description: The country of the customers IP

ipCountryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the customers IP

ipCountryCode3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the customers IP

ipMatchesBin.description: True if the customers IP country matches the BIN country

ipRegion.description: The region of the customers IP (if detectable)

isCommercial.description: Is this a commercial/business use card

isPrepaid.description: Is this a prepaid or prepaid reloadable card

valid.description: Is this a valid BIN or IIN number

badWordsList.description: An array of the bad words found

badWordsTotal.description: Total number of bad words detected

censoredContent.description: The censored content (only set if censor-character has been set)

isBad.description: Does the text contain bad words

isListed.description: true if listed, false if not

listRating.description: the list rating [1-3] with 1 being the best rating and 3 the lowest rating

responseTime.description: the DNSBL server response time in milliseconds

returnCode.description: the specific return code for this listing (if listed)

txtRecord.description: the TXT record returned for this listing (if listed)

content.description: The complete raw, decompressed and decoded page content. Usually will be either HTML, JSON or XML

elements.description: Array containing all the elements matching the supplied selector. Each element object will contain the text content, HTML content and all current element attributes

errorMessage.description: Contains the error message if an error has occurred ('is-error' will be true)

execResults.description: If you executed any JavaScript this array holds the results as objects

httpRedirectUrl.description: The redirected URL if the URL responded with an HTTP redirect

httpStatusCode.description: The HTTP status code the URL returned

httpStatusMessage.description: The HTTP status message the URL returned

isError.description: True if an error has occurred loading the page. Check the 'error-message' field for details

isHttpOk.description: True if the HTTP status is OK (200)

isHttpRedirect.description: True if the URL responded with an HTTP redirect

isSecure.description: True if the page is secured using TLS/SSL

isTimeout.description: True if a timeout occurred while loading the page. You can set the timeout with the request parameter 'timeout'

languageCode.description: The ISO 2-letter language code of the page. Extracted from either the HTML document or via HTTP headers

loadTime.description: The number of seconds taken to load the page (from initial request until DOM ready)

responseHeaders.description: Map containing all the HTTP response headers the URL responded with

securityDetails.description: Map containing details of the TLS/SSL setup

fromType.description: The type of the value being converted from

result.description: The result of the conversion in string format

resultFloat.description: The result of the conversion as a floating-point number

valid.description: True if the coversion was successful and produced a valid result

domainError.description: True if this address has a domain error (e.g. no valid mail server records)

email.description: The email address. If you have used the fix-typos option then this will be the fixed address

isDisposable.description: True if this address is a disposable, temporary or darknet related email address

isFreemail.description: True if this address is a free-mail address

isPersonal.description: True if this address belongs to a person. False if this is a role based address, e.g. admin@, help@, office@, etc.

syntaxError.description: True if this address has a syntax error

typosFixed.description: True if typos have been fixed

domainError.description: True if this address has a domain error (e.g. no valid mail server records)

email.description: The email address. If you have used the fix-typos option then this will be the fixed address

isCatchAll.description: True if this email domain has a catch-all policy (it will accept mail for any username)

isDeferred.description: True if the mail server responded with a temporary failure (either a 4xx response code or unresponsive server). You can retry this address later, we recommend waiting at least 15 minutes before retrying

isDisposable.description: True if this address is a disposable, temporary or darknet related email address

isFreemail.description: True if this address is a free-mail address

isPersonal.description: True if this address is for a person. False if this is a role based address, e.g. admin@, help@, office@, etc.

smtpResponse.description: The raw SMTP response message received during verification

smtpStatus.description:
The SMTP verification status for the address:
  • ok - SMTP verification was successful, this is a real address that can receive mail
  • invalid - this is not a valid email address (has either a domain or syntax error)
  • absent - this address is not registered with the email service provider
  • unresponsive - the mail server(s) for this address timed-out or refused to open an SMTP connection
  • unknown - sorry, we could not reliably determine the real status of this address (this address may or may not exist)

syntaxError.description: True if this address has a syntax error

typosFixed.description: True if typos have been fixed

valid.description: Is this a valid email address (syntax and domain is valid)

verified.description: True if this address has passed SMTP verification. Check the smtp-status and smtp-response fields for specific verification details

found.description: The number of possible matching locations found

addressComponents.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state, etc

countryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

countryCode3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the location

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

found.description: True if these coordinates map to a real location

locationTags.description: Array of strings containing any location tags associated with the address. Tags are additional pieces of metadata about a specific location, there are thousands of different tags. Some examples of tags: shop, office, cafe, bank, pub

locationType.description:
The detected location type ordered roughly from most to least precise, possible values are:
  • address - indicates a precise street address
  • street - accurate to the street level but may not point to the exact location of the house/building number
  • city - accurate to the city level, this includes villages, towns, suburbs, etc
  • postal-code - indicates a postal code area (no house or street information present)
  • railway - location is part of a rail network such as a station or railway track
  • natural - indicates a natural feature, for example a mountain peak or a waterway
  • island - location is an island or archipelago
  • administrative - indicates an administrative boundary such as a country, state or province

postalCode.description: The postal code for the location

timezone.description:
Map containing timezone details for the location:
  • id - the time zone ID as per the IANA time zone database (tzdata)
  • name - the time zone name
  • abbr - the time zone abbreviation
  • date - the current date within the time zone (ISO format)
  • time - the current time within the time zone (ISO format)

countryCode.description: The number location as an ISO 2-letter country code

countryCode3.description: The number location as an ISO 3-letter country code

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

hlrStatus.description:
The HLR lookup status, possible values are:
  • ok - the HLR lookup was successful and the device is connected
  • absent - the number was once registered but the device has been switched off or out of network range for some time
  • unknown - the number is not known by the mobile network
  • invalid - the number is not a valid mobile MSISDN number
  • fixed-line - the number is a registered fixed-line not mobile
  • voip - the number has been detected as a VOIP line
  • failed - the HLR lookup has failed, we could not determine the real status of this number

hlrValid.description: Was the HLR lookup successful. If true then this is a working and registered cell-phone or mobile device (SMS and phone calls will be delivered)

imsi.description: The mobile IMSI number (International Mobile Subscriber Identity)

internationalNumber.description: The number represented in full international format

isMobile.description: True if this is a mobile number (only true with 100% certainty, if the number type is unknown this value will be false)

isPorted.description: Has this number been ported to another network

isRoaming.description: Is this number currently roaming from its origin country

localNumber.description: The number represented in local dialing format

location.description: The number location. Could be a city, region or country depending on the type of number

mcc.description: The mobile MCC number (Mobile Country Code)

mnc.description: The mobile MNC number (Mobile Network Code)

msc.description: The mobile MSC number (Mobile Switching Center)

msin.description: The mobile MSIN number (Mobile Subscription Identification Number)

numberType.description:
The number type, possible values are:
  • mobile
  • fixed-line
  • premium-rate
  • toll-free
  • voip
  • unknown

numberValid.description: True if this a valid phone number

portedNetwork.description: The ported to network/carrier name (only set if the number has been ported)

roamingCountryCode.description: If the number is currently roaming, the ISO 2-letter country code of the roaming in country

host.description: The IP address or host name

listCount.description: The number of DNSBLs the host is listed on

lists.description:
An array of objects for each DNSBL checked, with the following keys:
  • is-listed - true if listed, false if not
  • list-name - the name of the DNSBL
  • list-host - the domain/hostname of the DNSBL
  • list-rating - the list rating [1-3] with 1 being the best rating and 3 the lowest rating
  • txt-record - the TXT record returned for this listing (if listed)
  • return-code - the specific return code for this listing (if listed)
  • response-time - the DNSBL server response time in milliseconds

blocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklists this IP is listed on (empty if not listed)

isBot.description: IP is hosting a malicious bot or is part of a botnet. Includes brute-force crackers

isDshield.description: IP has been flagged as an attack source on DShield (dshield.org)

isExploitBot.description: IP is hosting an exploit finding bot or is running exploit scanning software

isHijacked.description: IP is part of a hijacked netblock or a netblock controlled by a criminal organization

isListed.description: Is this IP on a blocklist

isMalware.description: IP is involved in distributing or is running malware

isProxy.description: IP has been detected as an anonymous web proxy or anonymous HTTP proxy

isSpamBot.description: IP address is hosting a spam bot, comment spamming or any other spamming type software

isSpider.description: IP is running a hostile web spider / web crawler

isSpyware.description: IP is involved in distributing or is running spyware

isTor.description: IP is a Tor node or running a Tor related service

isVpn.description: IP belongs to a public VPN provider (only set if the 'vpn-lookup' option is enabled)

lastSeen.description: The last time this IP was seen on a blocklist (in Unix time or 0 if not listed recently)

listCount.description: The number of blocklists the IP is listed on

sensors.description: An array of objects containing details on which sensors were used to detect this IP

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

hostDomain.description: The IPs host domain (only set if reverse-lookup has been used)

hostname.description: The IPs full hostname (only set if reverse-lookup has been used)

isBogon.description: True if this is a bogon IP address such as a private network, local network or reserved address

isV4Mapped.description: True if this is a IPv4 mapped IPv6 address

isV6.description: True if this is a IPv6 address. False if IPv4

timezone.description:
Map containing timezone details for the location:
  • id - the time zone ID as per the IANA time zone database (tzdata)
  • name - the time zone name
  • abbr - the time zone abbreviation
  • date - the current date within the time zone (ISO format)
  • time - the current time within the time zone (ISO format)

valid.description: True if this is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

asAge.description: The age of the autonomous system (AS) in number of years since registration

asCountryCode.description: The autonomous system (AS) ISO 2-letter country code

asCountryCode3.description: The autonomous system (AS) ISO 3-letter country code

asDescription.description: The autonomous system (AS) description / company name

asDomains.description: Array of all the domains associated with the autonomous system (AS)

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

isBogon.description: True if this is a bogon IP address such as a private network, local network or reserved address

isHosting.description: True if this IP belongs to a hosting company. Note that this can still be true even if the provider type is VPN/proxy, this occurs in the case that the IP is detected as both types

isIsp.description: True if this IP belongs to an internet service provider. Note that this can still be true even if the provider type is VPN/proxy, this occurs in the case that the IP is detected as both types

isProxy.description: True if this IP ia a proxy

isV4Mapped.description: True if this is a IPv4 mapped IPv6 address

isV6.description: True if this is a IPv6 address. False if IPv4

isVpn.description: True if this IP ia a VPN

providerDescription.description: A description of the provider (usually extracted from the providers website)

providerDomain.description: The domain name of the provider

providerType.description:
The detected provider type, possible values are:
  • isp - IP belongs to an internet service provider. This includes both mobile, home and business internet providers
  • hosting - IP belongs to a hosting company. This includes website hosting, cloud computing platforms and colocation facilities
  • vpn - IP belongs to a VPN provider
  • proxy - IP belongs to a proxy service. This includes HTTP/SOCKS proxies and browser based proxies
  • university - IP belongs to a university/college/campus
  • government - IP belongs to a government department. This includes military facilities
  • commercial - IP belongs to a commercial entity such as a corporate headquarters or company office
  • unknown - could not identify the provider type

providerWebsite.description: The website URL for the provider

valid.description: True if this is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

vpnDomain.description: The domain of the VPN provider (may be empty if the VPN domain is not detectable)

addressComponents.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state etc. May also include additional metadata about the address

countryCode.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

countryCode3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the location

postalCode.description: The postal code for the location

state.description: The state of the location (if applicable)

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

numberValid.description: True if this a valid phone number

countryCode.description: The phone number country as an ISO 2-letter country code

countryCode3.description: The phone number country as an ISO 3-letter country code

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

internationalNumber.description: The number represented in full international format (E.164)

isMobile.description: True if this is a mobile number. If the number type is unknown this value will be false

localNumber.description: The number represented in local dialing format

location.description: The phone number location. Could be the city, region or country depending on the type of number

prefixNetwork.description: The network/carrier who owns the prefix (this only works for some countries, use HLR lookup for global network detection)

type.description:
The number type based on the number prefix. Possible values are:
  • mobile
  • fixed-line
  • premium-rate
  • toll-free
  • voip
  • unknown (use HLR lookup)

valid.description: Is this a valid phone number

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

numberValid.description: True if this a valid phone number

securityCode.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

numberValid.description: True if this a valid phone number

sent.description: True if the SMS has been sent

numberValid.description: True if this a valid phone number

securityCode.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

sent.description: True if the SMS has been sent

content.description: The actual content this URL responded with. Only set if the 'fetch-content' option was used

contentEncoding.description: The encoding format the URL uses

contentSize.description: The size of the URL content in bytes

httpOk.description: True if this URL responded with an HTTP OK (200) status

httpRedirect.description: True if this URL responded with an HTTP redirect

httpStatus.description: The HTTP status code this URL responded with. An HTTP status of 0 indicates a network level issue

httpStatusMessage.description: The HTTP status message assoicated with the status code

isError.description: True if an error occurred while loading the URL. This includes network errors, TLS errors and timeouts

isTimeout.description: True if a timeout occurred while loading the URL. You can set the timeout with the request parameter 'timeout'

languageCode.description: The ISO 2-letter language code of the page. Extracted from either the HTML document or via HTTP headers

loadTime.description: The time taken to load the URL content in seconds

query.description: A key-value map of the URL query paramaters

real.description: Is this URL actually serving real content

serverCity.description: The servers IP geo-location: full city name (if detectable)

serverCountry.description: The servers IP geo-location: full country name

serverCountryCode.description: The servers IP geo-location: ISO 2-letter country code

serverIp.description: The IP address of the server hosting this URL

serverName.description: The name of the server software hosting this URL

serverRegion.description: The servers IP geo-location: full region name (if detectable)

url.description: The fully qualified URL. This may be different to the URL requested if http-redirect is true

urlProtocol.description: The URL protocol, usually http or https

valid.description: Is this a valid well-formed URL

isAndroid.description: True if this is an Android based mobile user agent

isIos.description: True if this is an iOS based mobile user agent

isMobile.description: True if this is a mobile user agent

mobileBrowser.description: The mobile device browser name (this is usually the same as the browser name)

mobileScreenHeight.description: The estimated mobile device screen height in CSS 'px'

mobileScreenWidth.description: The estimated mobile device screen width in CSS 'px'

operatingSystem.description: The full operating system name which may include the major version number or code name

operatingSystemFamily.description: The operating system family name, this is the OS name without any version information

operatingSystemVersion.description: The operating system version number (if detectable)

producer.description: The producer or manufacturer of the user agent

type.description:
The user agent type, possible values are:
  • desktop-browser
  • mobile-browser
  • email-client
  • feed-reader
  • software-library
  • media-player (includes smart TVs)
  • robot
  • unknown

verified.description: True if the code is valid

fix-typos.description: Automatically attempt to fix typos in the address
